title: 2 Thessalonians Quiz - Complete Book
description: Test your comprehensive knowledge of the entire book of 2 Thessalonians with 25 questions covering key events, people, and teachings from all 3 chapters.

questions.question: Who are the three individuals greeting the church of the Thessalonians at the start of the epistle?
questions.explanation: The epistle starts with Paul, Silvanus, and Timotheus greeting the Thessalonian church.

questions.question: What two blessings does Paul wish upon the Thessalonians in the opening greetings?
questions.explanation: Paul wishes grace and peace from God the Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.

questions.question: Why does Paul say he is bound to thank God always for the Thessalonians?
options: Because their faith groweth exceedingly and their charity aboundeth
Because they lived in peace with neighbors
questions.correctAnswer: Because their faith groweth exceedingly and their charity aboundeth
questions.explanation: Paul thanks God for their increasing faith and love toward each other.

questions.question: What are the Thessalonians commended for enduring, according to 2 Thessalonians 1:4?
questions.explanation: Paul commends their patience and faith during persecutions and tribulations.

questions.question: What is described as a manifest token of the righteous judgment of God in 2 Thessalonians 1?
options: That the Thessalonians may be counted worthy of the kingdom of God
questions.correctAnswer: That the Thessalonians may be counted worthy of the kingdom of God
questions.explanation: Their suffering is a sign of God's righteous judgment that they may be worthy of His kingdom.

questions.question: According to 2 Thessalonians 1:7, who will receive rest when the Lord Jesus is revealed from heaven?
questions.explanation: God will give rest to those who are troubled when Jesus returns with His angels.

questions.question: What kind of fire is mentioned as taking vengeance on those who know not God?
questions.explanation: The Lord will take vengeance with flaming fire on those disobedient to the gospel.

questions.question: What is the punishment described for those who do not obey the gospel of our Lord Jesus Christ?
options: Everlasting destruction from the presence of the Lord
questions.correctAnswer: Everlasting destruction from the presence of the Lord
questions.explanation: Unbelievers face everlasting destruction away from God's presence and power.

questions.question: What is the purpose of Paul's constant prayers for the Thessalonians in 2 Thessalonians 1:11?
options: That God would count them worthy of their calling and fulfill the work of faith
That they might be rich and famous
That they would avoid all suffering
That they would lead a life of ease
questions.correctAnswer: That God would count them worthy of their calling and fulfill the work of faith
questions.explanation: Paul prays that God would empower them to live faithfully and glorify Jesus.

questions.question: Who is revealed as the 'man of sin' or 'son of perdition' before the day of Christ comes?
options: The Wicked one who opposeth and exalteth himself
questions.correctAnswer: The Wicked one who opposeth and exalteth himself
questions.explanation: The 'man of sin' is a figure opposing God and exalting himself above all worship.

questions.question: What must happen first before the day of Christ can come, according to 2 Thessalonians 2:3?
questions.explanation: Paul states the day will not come except a falling away occurs first.

questions.question: Where does the man of sin set himself to be worshipped as God?
questions.explanation: He sits in the temple, showing himself that he is God.

questions.question: What is the 'mystery of iniquity' described as doing in 2 Thessalonians 2:7?
options: Being revealed openly from the beginning
questions.explanation: The mystery of iniquity is already at work, restrained only until the proper time.

questions.question: What will the Lord do to 'that Wicked' when he is revealed?
options: Consume him with the spirit of His mouth and destroy him with the brightness of His coming
Allow him to rule for a thousand years
questions.correctAnswer: Consume him with the spirit of His mouth and destroy him with the brightness of His coming
questions.explanation: The Lord will destroy the Wicked one at His coming.

questions.question: What kind of wonders and signs does the coming of the Wicked one involve?
options: Power of Satan with lying wonders and deceivableness of unrighteousness
questions.correctAnswer: Power of Satan with lying wonders and deceivableness of unrighteousness
questions.explanation: His coming is after the working of Satan with lying wonders and deceits.

questions.question: Why will God send them strong delusion, according to 2 Thessalonians 2:11?
options: Because they received not the love of the truth
questions.correctAnswer: Because they received not the love of the truth
questions.explanation: God sends delusion so they might believe lies due to their rejection of the truth.

questions.question: What is the result for those who believed not the truth but had pleasure in unrighteousness?
questions.explanation: Those who reject the truth and love unrighteousness face condemnation.

questions.question: According to 2 Thessalonians 2:13, what has God chosen believers from the beginning for?
options: Salvation through sanctification of the Spirit and belief of the truth
questions.correctAnswer: Salvation through sanctification of the Spirit and belief of the truth
questions.explanation: God chose them to salvation by sanctification and faith in truth.

questions.question: What are believers called to stand fast in, according to 2 Thessalonians 2:15?
options: The traditions taught by word or epistle
questions.correctAnswer: The traditions taught by word or epistle
questions.explanation: Paul instructs them to hold fast the traditions they were taught.

questions.question: What consolation and hope does God give believers through grace, as stated in 2 Thessalonians 2:16?
questions.explanation: God gives eternal comfort and hope through grace to believers.

questions.question: What does Paul ask the Thessalonians to pray for in the opening of chapter 3?
options: That the word of the Lord may have free course and be glorified
That they may be healed of sickness
questions.correctAnswer: That the word of the Lord may have free course and be glorified
questions.explanation: Paul requests prayer for the preaching of the word to be effective.

questions.question: From what type of men does Paul ask to be delivered in 2 Thessalonians 3:2?
questions.explanation: He asks for deliverance from wicked and unreasonable people.

questions.question: What does Paul say about the Lord's faithfulness in 2 Thessalonians 3:3?
options: He will stablish you and keep you from evil
questions.correctAnswer: He will stablish you and keep you from evil
questions.explanation: The Lord is faithful to strengthen and protect believers.

questions.question: What does Paul have confidence in regarding the Thessalonians in 2 Thessalonians 3:4?
options: That they both do and will do the things which he commands
That they will abandon the faith
That they will be persecuted no more
questions.correctAnswer: That they both do and will do the things which he commands
questions.explanation: Paul trusts the Thessalonians obey his instructions.

questions.question: Into what does Paul pray the Lord will direct the Thessalonians' hearts in 2 Thessalonians 3:5?
options: Love of God and patient waiting for Christ
Fear of man and avoidance of labor
questions.correctAnswer: Love of God and patient waiting for Christ
questions.explanation: Paul prays for hearts to be directed into God's love and patient hope.

questions.question: What does Paul command concerning a brother who walketh disorderly in 2 Thessalonians 3:6?
questions.explanation: Paul commands separation from disorderly brothers not following tradition.

questions.question: How did Paul and his companions behave among the Thessalonians, according to 2 Thessalonians 3:7?
questions.explanation: Paul reminds them they behaved properly and not disorderly.

questions.question: For what purpose did Paul and his companions work night and day while with the Thessalonians, as stated in 2 Thessalonians 3:8?
options: That they might not be chargeable to any of them
questions.correctAnswer: That they might not be chargeable to any of them
questions.explanation: They labored to avoid being a financial burden.

questions.question: Why did Paul work, even though he had the power not to, according to 2 Thessalonians 3:9?
options: To make an example for believers to follow
questions.correctAnswer: To make an example for believers to follow
questions.explanation: Paul worked to set an example, not out of necessity.

questions.question: What is the instruction given about those who will not work, according to 2 Thessalonians 3:10?
options: They should be given food anyway
They should be punished by law
They should be taught a lesson
questions.explanation: Paul commands that if anyone will not work, they should not eat.

questions.question: What behavior is attributed to some who walk disorderly among the Thessalonians in 2 Thessalonians 3:11?
questions.explanation: Some are idle and meddlesome instead of working.

questions.question: What does Paul command those disorderly idle people to do in 2 Thessalonians 3:12?
options: Work quietly and eat their own bread
questions.correctAnswer: Work quietly and eat their own bread
questions.explanation: Paul exhorts them to work quietly and provide for themselves.

questions.question: How does Paul encourage the brethren regarding doing good in 2 Thessalonians 3:13?
options: Do not be weary in well doing
Give up if it is hard
questions.correctAnswer: Do not be weary in well doing
questions.explanation: Believers are exhorted to persist in doing good.

questions.question: What should be done if anyone does not obey the word by this epistle, according to 2 Thessalonians 3:14?
options: Note him and have no company with him
questions.correctAnswer: Note him and have no company with him
questions.explanation: Paul instructs to mark disobedient persons and avoid socializing with them.

questions.question: How should such a disobedient person be regarded, according to 2 Thessalonians 3:15?
options: Not as an enemy, but admonish him as a brother
As an enemy to be shunned forever
As a stranger to be ignored
As a heretic to be expelled
questions.correctAnswer: Not as an enemy, but admonish him as a brother
questions.explanation: Paul advises correction in brotherly love, not hatred.

questions.question: Who gives peace always by all means in 2 Thessalonians 3:16?
questions.explanation: The Lord himself grants peace continually.

questions.question: What is the significance of Paul’s own handwriting in the epistle, as mentioned in 2 Thessalonians 3:17?
options: It is the token in every epistle
questions.correctAnswer: It is the token in every epistle
questions.explanation: Paul’s personal signature authenticates the letter.

questions.question: What does Paul wish to be with all the Thessalonians at the end of the epistle?
options: The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ
questions.correctAnswer: The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ
questions.explanation: Paul closes with a blessing of Christ’s grace upon them.

questions.question: Complete this verse: 'The Lord direct your hearts into the ______ of God, and into the patient waiting for Christ.'
questions.explanation: The verse prays that the Lord directs hearts into the love of God.

questions.question: Complete this verse: 'For even when we were with you, this we commanded you, That if any would not ______, neither should he eat.'
questions.explanation: Paul commands that those unwilling to work should not eat.

questions.question: True or False: Paul instructs the Thessalonians to hold fast the traditions taught by word or epistle.
questions.explanation: Paul exhorts them to stand fast in the traditions taught.

questions.question: True or False: The 'man of sin' is described as sitting humbly in the synagogue without claiming divinity.
questions.explanation: He exalteth himself above God and shows himself as God in the temple.

questions.question: True or False: Paul worked with labor and travail to avoid being a burden to the Thessalonians.
questions.explanation: Paul worked day and night so he would not be chargeable to anyone.

questions.question: True or False: Paul encourages the Thessalonians to keep company with disorderly brethren to help them change.
questions.explanation: Paul commands to have no company with disobedient brethren to shame them.

questions.question: Complete this verse: 'Now our Lord Jesus Christ himself, and God, even our Father, which hath loved us, and hath given us ______ consolation and good hope through grace.'
questions.explanation: God gives everlasting consolation and hope through grace.
